Summary: A gold/orange light moved from low in the SE to high and overhead
divs: sighting details i was watching a late movie and the power went out so i went outside to see if other houses had lost power (they had) and let my dog relieve herself. it was predawn and it was partly cloudy. i saw a golden orange light that i thought might be a police helicopter searchlight moving in from the se but the light was too large and the wrong color and there was no sound or other running lights. the light moved rapidly up and diminished to a size slightly larger than jupitor or venus entering and exiting the clouds. it seemed to stop relative to my hand(the clouds were moving) for 4 to 5 seconds at one point and then moved higher and to the n-nw overhead to diminish until gone in a clear area of sky. the only possible thing i thought it might be was a light fastened to a balloon though some of the movements appeared to go against the wind and it moved rapidly up rather than across the sky as balloons usually do when caught by upper level winds. i felt the light was eerie and was strangly thrilled when seeing it. it did come from the direction of davis\monthan air force base, though. the date is approxmate but i know it was a friday night\saturday morning and the time is nearly correct as there was a power outage and the clocks were stopped at that time. incidently, the power came on about a 10 seconds after i lost sight of the object. my girlfriend saw the light once it was higher in the sky until it faded from view overhead. last month she had gone outside and saw two stationary "stars" suddenly move around each other as if "they were on a tether" and then move away in opposite directions. she called me outside and i only saw two lights like satellites moving in opposite directions, but i don't think they or airplanes can move like she described. odd.
